comments.body: I see, so the key point to this test is that this `.d.ts` doesn't turn into `node/events` because it's a special case global üëçüèª

This fix seems incorrect and an odd special case. We expect in cases like this one, to use the module name specified by the ambient module declaration, _not_ one from a filepath. Since the module is declared as `declare module "events"` we should only be using `"events"` to refer to it, and should never have looked at a filepath to begin with (notably: there's no guarantee the ambient module has the same name as the containing file!).
This change needs to be reverted and correctly fixed as @weswigham points out correctly.
